intro: Spergularia collina, commonly known as sea sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. This plant is typically found in coastal areas, sand dunes, and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Spergularia collina thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in coastal restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of salt-tolerant flora.
